*** Bug 179889 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Any comments from SWT?  Is the 32bit win32.x86 expected to run on x86_64?
Any new progress in this issue since I suffer the same problem?

Since the Stacktrace is in the end little bit different, I post it as well:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.equinox.app 4 0 2007-04-09 20:16:53.756
!MESSAGE Error in invoking method.
!STACK 0
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-win32-3320 or swt-win32 in swt.library.path, java.libary.path or the jar file
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:219)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:18)
....


java -version =>>

java version "1.6.0"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0-b105)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.6.0-b105, mixed mode)

Q: Is there a way to fix it manually? e.g. download some old SWT-files and set the path.

After playing a little bit around I figured out where the source of the problem is:

I have installed 

jdk-6-windows-amd64.exe

which does NOT include a JRE + some other plugins (like Internet-Explorer). Setting the Path manually for Java then the Java is recognized. 

Installing

jdk-6u1-ea-bin-b01-windows-i586-p-14_dec_2006.exe

which includes a Hotfix for Java 1.6 as well as it installs the JRE the whole thing starts running.

Q: Why does the SWT require an installed JRE? Resp. which paths are read?
Andrew, this isn't SWT anymore, right?  It sounds like the guy wants to know why the launcher is finding the wrong java.  If so, can you take this bug?

I don't understand comment #5.  Of course SWT requires a JRE, it's java.  A JDK is normally a JRE + source/docs.  I haven't been able to look at jdk-6-windows-amd64.exe since it won't install on my machine.

Note the original bug reported was 3.2.1, that launcher simply exec'ed whatever java it found on the path if none was specified with -vm.

Leopold, you seem to be running 3.3, which java is getting used by eclipse?  Try running the latest IBuild from a console with "eclipse -debug -console" and see if you get a "Start VM: ..." message, look for the -vm line.  (Note this would only come up if java is being loaded in-process from a .dll).

traces.message: C:\eclipse\configuration\org.eclipse.osgi\bundles\217\1\.cp\swt-win32-3235.dll: Can't load IA 32-bit .dll on a AMD 64-bit platform
no swt-win32-3320 or swt-win32 in swt.library.path, java.libary.path or the jar file
